column3: et invocábimus nomen tuum~; narrábimus mirabìlia tua. ^ We will praise thee
column5: and we will call upon thy name~; we will relate thy wondrous works.

column2: ego justìțias judicábo. ^ When I shall take a time

column1: 4 ^ Liqŭefácta est terra et òmnes qŭi hábitant in ea~; ego confirmávi colùmnas ejus. ^ The earth is melted and all that dwell therein~; I have established the pillars thereof.

column7: and to the sinners, Lift not up the horn

column1: 6 ^ nolíte extòllere in altum cornu vèstrum~; nolíte loqŭi advèrsus Deum iniqŭitátem.~»^ lift not up your horn on high~; speak not iniquity against God."
8 ^ qŭóniam Deus judex est. Hunc humìliat
column2: et hunc exáltat~; ^ For God is the judge. One he putteth down

column1: 9 ^ qŭia calix in manu Dòmini vini mèri plénus mìxto
column2: et inclinávit ex hoc in hoc
column3: verùmtamen faĕx ejus non est exinaníta~; bibent òmnes peccatóres terraĕ. ^ for in the hand of the Lord there is a cup of strong wine full of mixture
column4: and he hath poured it out from this to that
column5: but the dregs thereof are not emptied~; all the sinners of the earth shall drink.

column1: 10 ^ Ego aŭtem adnunțiábo in sáĕculum~; cantábo Deo Jacóbis~; ^ But I will declare for ever~; I will sing to the God of Jacob~;

column2: et exaltabùntur córnua justi. ^ and I will break all the horns of sinners
column3: but the horns of the just shall be exalted.
